title: 106_hr2657
content: The "Teacher Next Door Act" aims to address the challenges faced by urban and inner city school districts in attracting and retaining qualified teachers due to higher property costs in these areas. Section 204 of the National Housing Act is amended to allow the Secretary to sell eligible properties at a discount to teachers under the Teacher Next Door Program, with specific requirements for the property's use as a primary residence for at least a 3-year period. The Secretary may sell eligible properties at a discount to teachers for use as a primary residence, with sale price set at 50% of the appraised value. Sale methods include selling to local government or nonprofit organizations for resale to teachers. Mortgage downpayment assistance is provided for teachers purchasing eligible properties, and regulations are in place to prevent undue profit from resale. An awareness program is also implemented to inform schools and the public about these opportunities.
